content:
• Friday, June 29, 2018
  • PFBC

    Preferred Bank +2% on move to SmallCap 600

    • Los Angeles-based Preferred Bank (NASDAQ:PFBC) is up 2% after hours on news that it will join the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • It's replacing Infinity Property & Casualty (NASDAQ:IPCC), which is set to be acquired by MidCap 400 firm Kemper on Monday.
    • The move is effective before the open on Friday, July 6.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • BWP

    Loews to purchase all Boardwalk Pipeline Partners units

    • Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (NYSE:BWP) +2.6% after-hours as Loews (NYSE:L) says the general partner elects to exercise its right to purchase all outstanding common units in BWP it does not already own.
    • Loews says the GP will purchase the transaction units on July 18 for $12.06/unit, totaling ~$1.5B.
    • The purchase price was based on the average of the daily closing prices for the units over 180 consecutive trading days ending on June 29.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 32 Comments
  • PED

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/29/2018)

    • Top Gainers: PED +15%. ELOX +9%. OTCPK:BRRP +6%. ASNA +4%. HIBB +4%.
    • Top Losers: OTC:SCCAF -6%. FTD -5%. HZN -5%. JMLP -5%. KTOS -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 5 Comments

  • Crude oil caps huge weekly gains amid global supply outages

    • U.S. crude oil continues to sizzle, settling +1% at $74.15/bbl, its best closing price since November 2014 and capping a four-session winning streak on the back of declining crude inventories and rising concerns over supply disruptions.
    • Prices for the front-month WTI contract jumped 8% this week, 11% for the month, 14% for the quarter and nearly 23% so far this year.
    • Brent crude gained even more today, +2% to $79.44/bbl, just shy of a three-and-a-half year high, although its longer-term gains have been a bit less dramatic than WTI, rising 5% for the week, 2.4% for the month, 13% for Q2 and 18.8% YTD.
    • Even as Saudi Arabia and other countries prepared to increase production, prices have been lifted by threats to supply from Iran, Libya, Venezuela and even Canada; in Libya, the supply of up to 780K bbl/day is at risk, according to analysts at Commerzbank.
    • At the same time, infrastructure constraints in U.S. shale - particularly in the Permian Basin - have limited supply expansion.
    • "It is becoming increasingly clear that Saudi Arabia and Russia will struggle to compensate for potential losses in oil production from the likes of Venezuela, Iran and Libya," says Interfax Energy analyst Abhishek Kumar.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 40 Comments
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy delisted from NYSE, moves to Pink Sheets

    • Yingli Green Energy (YGE -6.5%) says it was notified by the NYSE that delisting proceedings will begin, as its American Depositary Shares were no longer in compliance with continued listing standards after failing to maintain an average global market cap at least $50M over a consecutive 30 trading-day period.
    • Trading in the company's ADSs was suspended this morning.
    • YGE says it will not appeal the delisting determination and expects its ADSs will begin trading on the OTC Pink Sheets on July 2 under the symbol YGEHY.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 7 Comments
  • ELON

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 PM (06/29/2018)

    • Gainers: ELON +98%. SPCB +46%. AVLR +14%. SMAR +8%. HMI +7%.
    • Losers: LINK -20%. MTSL -13%. VVPR -11%. TEO -10%. MTBC -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • GM

    GM warns auto tariffs would make it a smaller company

    • General Motors (GM -2.2%) moves lower after warning the Trump Administration that U.S. tariffs on imported vehicles would lead to "a smaller GM."
    • GM said in comments filed today with the U.S. Commerce Department that broad tariffs could “lead to a smaller GM, a reduced presence at home and abroad for this iconic American company, and risk less - not more - U.S. jobs."
    • Earlier: Auto tariff would mean $45B in higher costs for U.S. consumers, group says (June 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 30 Comments
  • GBR

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/29/2018)

    • Gainers: GBR +165%. FRD +26%. MXC +14%. PED +13%. ENB +8%.
    • Losers: GEVO -36%. PFIE -8%. TUSK -6%. USEG -6%. FTSI -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • UBS

    UBS taps Deutsche Bank's Rose to co-lead M&A

    • UBS (UBS +1.2%) has a new co-chief of Americas mergers and acquisitions, hiring Jeff Rose from Deutsche Bank (DB +2.2%), Reuters reports.
    • Rose replaces Larry Grafstein, who departed for the Royal Bank of Canada.
    • He had been global co-head of consumer retail and services at Deutsche Bank, and had previously spent 17 years at Bank of America.
    • Rose officially starts in August and will work alongside co-chief Marc-Anthony Hourihan.
    • UBS has hired 10 new managing directors since the start of the year as it builds out its investment banking.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • CMCSA

    Comcast in nationwide service outage (updated)

    • The social media team at Comcast (CMCSA +2.3%) is acknowledging what looks more and more like a nationwide outage in its service.
    • TV and Internet are down for customers around the country with complaints spiking over the past hour.
    • The company says it's working to restore services as quickly as possible.
    • Updated 1:51 p.m.: Comcast acknowledges it's a nationwide outage and says it's working on a resolution. A fiber cut happened at a network partner that may be affecting other providers, it says.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 25 Comments
  • MSG

    MSG +3.6% as Macquarie raises to Outperform on spin-off planning

    • Madison Square Garden (NASDAQ:MSG) is up again, +3.6%, with Macquarie upgrading in the wake of the company's consideration of spinning off its sports businesses.
    • Analyst Amy Yong lifted her rating to Outperform.
    • Along with rising values for sports teams that can lift the New York Knicks and New York Rangers, the entertainment business could see a jolt from new Las Vegas/London spheres, which "could present significant upside" to annual entertainment revenue growth estimates, she writes. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Her price target is up to $350 from $302, implying 11.4% further upside.
    • Previously: MSG +10% as Jefferies boosts to Buy (Jun. 28 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • TAOIF

    More on TAG Oil's FY results

    • TAG Oil (OTCQX:TAOIF -2.8%) reported FY revenue of $23.7M (+1.7% Y/Y) and a 23% increase in operating netbacks to $30.66 per boe.
    • FY average net daily production was 1,120 boe/d down by 7% Y/Y.
    • Company has $1.8M in cash & cash equivalents and $3.4M in working capital as of March 31, 2018.
    • "During fiscal 2018 we focused on our waterflood program, exploration drilling and ensuring we maintained our production assets. Despite an average Brent Oil price of $57.52 over the year, we still achieved operating cash flow of $8.7M. In fiscal 2019, given the continued strength in Brent Oil pricing, our main focus will be on low-risk production growth, our waterflood program and adding to our exploration portfolio in New Zealand and Australia", mentioned Toby Pierce, CEO.
    • FY19 Outlook: Revenue $32.7M, with production avg. of ~1,300 boe/d, assuming Brent oil price for the year as $65 per bbl and Capital budget $12.4M.
    • Previously: TAG Oil reports FY results (June 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • GEVO

    Gevo -37% on upsized at-the-market stock offering

    • Gevo (GEVO -37.8%) plunges after disclosing plans to increase the amount of common shares for issuance and sale by as much as $66.9M in its at-the-market offering.
    • The previous sales agreement provided for the sale and issuance of up to nearly $23M of shares in the ATM offering.
    • Gevo plans to use the proceeds from the offering to fund working capital and for other general corporate purposes, which may include the paying down debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 21 Comments

  • GOGO

    Gogo sets July 13 call to discuss integrated business plan

    • Gogo (GOGO -1.5%) has set a conference call to discuss an integrated business plan it's been working on.
    • The company will hold the call at 9 a.m. ET on July 13.
    • It will share key conclusions in a press release after the market closes on July 12.
    • The goal of the planning, launched in April, was to "improve quality, further drive revenue growth, streamline business processes, prioritize operational initiatives and improve its cost structure."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 22 Comments
  • RYI

    Ryerson +4% following upside Q2 guidance

    • Ryerson (RYI +4.1%) is higher after guiding Q2 revenues of $1.04B-$1.05B, compared to $941M in Q1 2018 and $875M in the year-ago quarter and slightly above analyst expectations.
    • RYI says it expects Y/Y and Q/Q volume growth in nearly all end markets, particularly in commercial ground transportation, consumer durable equipment and industrial equipment.
    • RYI says it continues to see improved pricing conditions in Q2 as commodities appreciated compared to Q1 and the manufacturing economy remains strong.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • BFR

    Another record low for Argentine peso

    • The peso is down more than 3% today and over 7% for the week, meaning it now requires nearly 29 Argentine units to purchase one greenback. The continued tumble comes despite efforts by the country's central bank to prop it up (short rates are 40%, and the IMF has gotten involved).
    • "Further strikes could force President Macri into wage concessions, slowing progress in bringing down inflation and the budget deficit," says Capital Economics. Possibly what's really happening is the Fed rate hike cycle - something is always the first to crack, and maybe this time it's emerging markets, with Argentina leading the way.
    • ETF: ARGT -1.6%
    • Notable ADRs: BBFA BAnco Frances SA (BFR -7.4%), Grupo Financiero Galicia SA (GGAL -7.8%), Banco Macro (BMA -6.8%), Loma Negra (LOMA -4.2%), Grupo Supervielle (SUPV -5.9%), Petrobras Argentina (PZE), Telecom Argentina (TEO -8.5%), Tenaris (TS +0.4%), Ternium (TX +1.1%), Transportadora de Gas del Sur (TGS -7.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM | 9 Comments
  • GATX

    GATX +6% as railcar sector view boosted by Greenbrier earnings

    • GATX (GATX +6.3%) jumps after the railcar sector’s outlook was brightened when peer Greenbrier’s (GBX +10.7%) Q3 earnings beat estimates and Mizuho initiates coverage of GATX as a Buy and an $88 price target.
    • Mizuho analyst Kristine Kubacki says GATX has strong management that expertly managed the last railcar boom and bust; freight traffic is improving and railcar supply is tightening, and the cycle still has risks, but GATX has managed those risks, Kubacki says.
    • Railcar peers also are higher: TRN +5.5%, ARII +1.4%, RAIL +1.2%.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 4 Comments
  • NTAP

    NetApp +2% on BofA target boost

    • Bank of America raises its NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) price target from $84 to $88 and reiterates a Buy rating.
    • Analyst Wamsi Mohan cites the company’s shift to AI-driven storage workloads and leadership in flash array platforms. 
    • The analyst expects “sustained low-double to high-single-digit product revenue growth for NetApp in the next few years.” 
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word. 
    • NetApp shares are up 2% to $78.86.       
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM

  • AZN

    AstraZeneca up on CHMP approval for once-weekly Bydureon

    • AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) announces that CHMP has recommended inclusion of Bydureon in a once-weekly, pre-filled device as a new formulation within the Bydureon marketing authorization for treating type 2 diabetes.
    • AstraZeneca shares are up 0.9% to $35.22.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • STZ

    Constellation Brands -4% after Q1 earnings miss

    • Constellation Brands (STZ -4.1%) after reporting a sharp miss in its Q1 earnings expectations and reaffirming below-consensus guidance for the full year.
    • STZ says higher freight costs, a rising dollar and increased marketing reduced Q1 operating margins in its beer business by 230 bps to 37.8%, even as unit sales rose 11% Y/Y to $1.38B while operating income improved 4.5% to $520M.
    • Wine and spirits net sales fell 2.5% to $672M while operating income fell 16.8% to $168Mi and segment operating margin fell 430 bps to 25% due to higher grape prices and higher transportation costs.
    • STZ reaffirms FY 2019 guidance, seeing EPS of $9.40-$9.70, vs. $9.72 analyst consensus estimate; it expects its beer business to generate net sales and operating income growth of 9%-11% and wine and spirits net sales and operating income to grow 2%-4% during the fiscal year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • SNX

    SYNNEX Corporation slides 7.7% post Q2 results

    • SYNNEX Corporation (SNX -7.7%) reports Q2 revenue growth of 26.1% Y/Y to $4.9B of which Technology Solutions was $4.5B (+30% Y/Y) & Concentrix was $491M (+2% Y/Y).
    • Adj. operating margin: Technology Solutions declined 50 bps to 2.5%; Concentrix increased 30 bps to 8.4% & total declined 53 bps to 3.06%.
    • Adj. EBITDA margin: Technology Solutions declined 48 bps to 2.6%; Concentrix increased 63 bps to 12% & total declined 56 bps to 3.52%.
    • The adj. trailing fiscal four quarters ROIC was 10.9%.
    • The debt to capitalization ratio increased 1,000 bps to 43.9%, was due to a result of the Westcon-Comstor Americas acquisition in Q4 2017.
    • CFO was ~$68M with depreciation and amortization of $23M and $26M, respectively.
    • The company declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.35 per common share payable on July 27, 2018.
    • Q3 Outlook: Revenue to be $4.8-5B; Net income of $77.9-81.6M and Adj. net income of $97-100.7M; EPS of $1.95-$2.04 and Adj. EPS of $2.42-$2.52 & After-tax amortization of intangibles to be $19.1M.
    • Previously: Synnex beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (June 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • TPCS

    TechPrecision up 4% post Q4 results

    • TechPrecision (OTCQB:TPCS +4.6%) reported Q4 net sales of $4.67M (-5.3% Y/Y). Net sales in precision industrial market increased by $0.5M, nuclear market decreased by $1.2M and defense market increase by $0.4M compared to same quarter year ago.
    • Q4 Overall margins: Gross declined by 1,286 bps to 8.14% and operating declined by 1,411 bps to 8.41%
    • Company has $2.7M in cash and $4.9M as working capital as of March 31, 2018.
    • Sales order backlog was $14M as of March 31, 2018 vs $15.8M a year ago.
    • “Our results were impacted by lower gross margins for fiscal 2018, which were primarily the result of higher amounts of unabsorbed overhead related to a slowdown in the number of projects in production. Additionally, we experienced a higher volume of low margin components shipped during the period. We expect to return to levels of project activity during fiscal 2019 that are more consistent with our prior year results of operations”, commented Alexander Shen, CEO.
    • Previously: Techprecision reports Q4 results (June 29)
    • Transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 3 Comments
  • OSTK

    Overstock +10.4% on $160M crypto deal

    • Overstock.com’s (NASDAQ:OSTK) crypto subsidiary TZero signs a $160M deal with Hong Kong private equity firm GSR Capital.
    • GSR will buy $160M in tokens at $10 each.
    • Overstock says that TZero has entered into over $168M of token agreements as of yesterday and over $95M have been funded.
    • TZero will use the proceeds to launch its security-token exchange and for general corporate purposes.
    • Overstock shares are up 10.4% to $33.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 18 Comments
  • DERM

    Evercore sees big market for new Dermira drug; shares +5.5%

    • Dermira (NASDAQ:DERM) is up 5.5%, with Evercore seeing solid market opportunity after the company's prescription wipe for excessive underarm sweat won FDA approval.
    • Some 800,000 people are treated for primary axillary hyperhidrosis, analyst Umer Raffat notes, and peak risk-adjusted sales are modeled at $200M. Investors now will look toward phase 2B data for lebrikizumab in atopic dermatitis due early next year. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Raffat has a price target of $16, implying 73% further upside from here.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 5 Comments
  • GEMP

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/29/2018)

    • Gainers: GEMP +80%. XLRN +40%. VRTX +15%. INNT +14%. XENE +13%.
    • Losers: XBIO -14%. NMRD -12%. CHFS -10%. ASNS -9%. TRXC -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • BHF

    Brighthouse perks up after Evercore upgrades, citing depressed valuation

    • Brighthouse Financial (BHF +2.6%) rises after Evercore ISI analyst Tom Gallagher upgrades BHF to outperform from inline, citing its depressed valuation, Bloomberg reports.
    • Price target cut to $53 from $65.
    • Gallagher wrote the the life insurance category is full of inexpensive stocks with low valuations, the selloff of stocks with large variable annuity blocks, though, was "particularly overdone."
    • He also said variable annuity blocks are better capitalized in BHF, Axa Equitable Holdings (EQH +1.9%), and Lincoln National (LNC +1.6%) than in others.
    • Previously: Brighthouse drops to new low, hobbled by bear market (June 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 5 Comments

  • Oil's bull run shows up in options

    • Oil's big run higher in the last half of the month has brought back the bulls, with Bloomberg's Alex Longley reporting that WTI options are trading with a bullish skew for the first time in about six weeks.
    • It was only one week ago, he writes, that traders' demand for puts was the largest since March. Later today will be the CFTC Commitments of Traders report.
    • WTI today is up another 1% to $74.21 per barrel.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWT, UCO, DWT, SCO, BNO, DBO, UGA, DTO, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, WTIU, OILK, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, UBRT, DBRT, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 14 Comments
  • WFC

    Financials on the rise as Fed allows higher dividends, bigger buybacks

    • The Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (NYSEARCA:XLF) gains 1.3% the morning after the Federal Reserve gave the go-ahead for most banks' capital return plans.
    • Wells Fargo (WFC +4.7%) led the climb as it plans to boost its quarterly dividend by 10% to 43 cents a share from 39 cents. And it's more than doubling its stock buyback program to $24.5B from $11.5B in the '17 plan.
    • Investors had been concerned about how much WFC would be allowed to return to shareholders after it had said in May that it would be subject to a Fed-imposed asset cap longer than it expected.
    • Citigroup (C +2%) also gained on plans to increase its quarterly dividend by 41% to 45 cents a share from 32 cents, and to buy back up to $17.6B of common stock over the next four quarters.
    • Morgan Stanley (MS +0.3%) and Goldman Sachs (GS +0.2%), though, were limited to keeping their capital distributions at "levels they paid in recent years," the Fed said.
    • "Each firm's capital ratios, under the capital plans they originally submitted and with the one-time capital reduction from the tax law changes, fell below required levels when subjected to the hypothetical scenario," the Fed said.
    • State Street (STT +0.5%) also received a conditional non-objection for its capital plan because the test revealed counterparty exposures that produced large losses under the hypothetical scenario, which assumes the firm's largest counterparty defaults.
    • Among financials gaining today after the stress test results: Bank of America (BAC +1.2%), JPMorgan (JPM +1.2%),  U.S. Bancorp (USB +1.7%), Fifth Third (FITB +1.8%), KeyCorp (KEY +1.7%), M&T Bank (MTB +2.2%), SunTrust Banks (STI +2.3%), American Express (AXP +2%), Discover Financial (DFS +1.7%),  Ally Financial (ALLY +3.9%), Santander Consumer USA (SC +1.7%)
    • ETFs: FAS, FAZ, KRE, VFH, KBE, UYG, FNCL, IYF, BTO, IAT, KIE, IYG, KBWB, IAK, IAI, RYF, KBWP,
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 43 Comments
  • ENB

    Enbridge, Enbridge Energy, Spectra Energy all +5% after Line 3 win

    • Enbridge (ENB +5.5%), Enbridge Energy Partners (EEP +4.8%) and Spectra Energy Partners (SEP +5.4%) enjoy continued strength after the Minnesota Public Utilities Commission yesterday approved the Line 3 replacement project.
    • The PUC also approved a route that closely follows the company's preference with minor modifications and conditions, including a financial guarantee to clean up any environmental damage.
    • The decision clears the final major hurdle, pending possible appeals, in ENB's three-year effort to rebuild its aging, corroded 1,031-mile pipeline that runs from Alberta in western Canada to Wisconsin.
    • ENB says the project's cost estimate remains materially unchanged at C$5.3B in Canada and US$2.9B in the U.S., with $3.6B spent so far; the company continues to anticipate an in-service date in H2 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 57 Comments
  • GEMP

    Jefferies sees more headroom for Gemphire, up 97%

    • Gemphire Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GEMP) is up 96.8% today with praise from Jefferies after yesterday's news that its Gemcabene met a primary endpoint in a study of severe hypertriglyceridemia patients.
    • Shares may keep grinding higher throughout the year, analyst Matthew Andrews says, with a number of catalysts ahead: possible positive FDA feedback in Q3, emerging partnerships in the second half, and positive data in late 2018. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • He has a Buy rating and $15 price target, implying 45% further upside beyond today's near-doubled price.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • SYBX

    Synlogic +4.2% on initiation at 89% upside

    • Oppenheimer starts Synlogic (NASDAQ:SYBX) with an Outperform rating and $18 price target.
    • Target represents an 89% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Synlogic shares are up 4.2% to $9.93.       
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • BTC-USD

    Bitcoin crashes below $6K

    • Bitcoin (BTC-USD) earlier touched as low as $5,791, and is currently at $5,864. Ether (ETH-USD) and Litecoin (LTC-USD) are also at levels not seen since late last year.
    • The combined market cap of tokens tracked by CoinMarketCap.com has tumbled to $236B vs. $830B at the peak. For Bitcoin, it's down 70% from its December high. As comparison, the Nasdaq plunged 78% from its dot-com bubble top.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, OTCPK:BTLLF SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, OTCPK:BLKCF, COINB, BTC-USD, ETH-USD, XRP-USD, BCH-USD

  • BHC

    Valeant gets price target boost at Mizuho; shares up 1.75% premarket

    • Analyst Irina Koffler sees irritable bowel syndrome drug Xifaxan as the key growth driver for Valeant (VRX), not the company's dermatology portfolio.
    • She takes note of multiple commercial tactics the company is set to put to work to drive Xifaxan growth.
    • And don't rule out M&A potential, she says, as bond investors could support something modest.
    • Koffler lifts her price target to $31 from $27. Shares up 1.75% premarket to $23.78.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 93 Comments
  • ACAD

    Acadia Pharma +12% after FDA approves dosing, strength for Nuplazid

    • Acadia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACAD) +12.1% premarket after announcing Food and Drug Administration approval of a new capsule dose formulation and new tablet strength of Nuplazid (pimavanserin) for treatment of patients experiencing hallucinations and delusions associated with Parkinson’s disease psychosis.
    • ACAD says the FDA approval of a 34 mg Nuplazid capsule formulation will provide patients with the recommended 34 mg once daily dose in a single small capsule, and approval of a 10 mg tablet provides an optimized lower dosage strength.
    • ACAD says 4M-6M people worldwide suffer from Parkinson’s disease, with more than half suffering symptoms of psychosis over the course of their disease.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM | 48 Comments

  • FCAU

    Report: Hyundai may be preparing takeover bid for Fiat Chrysler

    • Fiat Chrysler (NYSE:FCAU) +3.2% premarket following speculation that Hyundai (OTCPK:HYMLF) CEO Chung Mong-koo is waiting for an expected decline in FCAU shares before launching a takeover bid for the company.
    • Asia Times reports the Hyundai bid would be launched sometime between this summer and prior to FCAU's annual shareholder meeting in May 2019, when Sergio Marchionne formally steps down as CEO.
    • According to the report, the key driver for a deal would be Elliott Management's Paul Singer, who has amassed a $1B stake in Hyundai and is a major player in Italian equities.

  • SNY

    Sanofi says CHMP recommends European approval for Cablivi

    • Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) +1.6% premarket after saying the European Medicines Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use has recommended approval of Cablivi (caplacizumab) in Europe for the treatment of adults experiencing an episode of acquired thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura.
    • SNY says Cablivi is the first therapeutic to receive positive CHMP opinion for treating aTTP, a rare blood-clotting disorder.
    • The European Commission will review the recommendation and issue a final decision on marketing authorization for Cablivi in the European Union in the coming months.
    • Also, SNY said yesterday it had finalized details on the sale of its European generics business Zentiva to Advent International for €1.9B ($2.2B).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
  • APTO

    Aptose +12% after FDA lifts clinical hold on blood cancer drug trial

    • Aptose Biosciences (NASDAQ:APTO) jumps 12% in premarket trading after the U.S. Food and Drug Administration lifts the clinical hold on APTO-253, Aptose's investigational drug for blood cancers.
    • The phase 1b trial of APTO-253 was placed on clinical hold in November 2015 after problems with an IV infusion pump occurred at a clinical trial site. An investigation found the event resulted from chemistry and manufacturing based issues, all of which were incorporated into a amendment to the investigational new drug application.
    • The company says APTO-253 is the only known clinical-stage molecule that has the potential to directly inhibit expression of the MYC oncogene, shown to be a causative factor in many malignancies, including acute myeloid leukemia.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Aptose secures rights to blood cancer candidate in China from CrystalGenomics for up to $125M; shares up 9% premarket (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM

  • GBX

    More on Greenbrier's Q3 mixed results

    • Greenbrier (NYSE:GBX) reports Manufacturing revenue rose 60.9% to $510.1M in Q3.
    • Wheels & Parts revenue up 10.9% to $94.52M.
    • Leasing & Services revenue -0.1% to $36.77M.
    • Gross margin rate deleveraged 350 bps to 16.9%.
    • S&A expense rate improved 160 bps to 8.1%.
    • Operating margin rate grew 20 bps to 11.2%.
    • New rail car deliveries increased 14.3% Q/Q to 5,600 units.
    • New railcar manufacturing backlog was 24.2K units valued at $2.3B at quarter's end.
    • FY2018 Guidance: Deliveries: 20,000 to 21,000 units; Revenues: ~$2.56B; Diluted EPS: $5.
    • Previously: Greenbrier beats by $0.16, misses on revenue (June 29)
